item.title: Project Logistics
item.description: Requirements Modelling: Web App for hosting. Reactive UI, readable on phone and Web. Obsidian Support Start here page with a mindmap for the whole book.

item.title: Economics 101
item.description: Incentives as desire. People respond to incentives Money is Freedom. It is the freedom to fulfill your desires to design a happier more enriching life. If you get bond to the money, then it is no longer serving its purpose.

item.title: Economics 102
item.description: Geopolitics, power, political economy. Why you need to understand some degree of geopolitics. Geopolitics and History is in some sense the story of flow of money.

item.title: Economics 103
item.description: Risk vs Reward. Leverage + Accountability + genuine curiosity how to choose a job.

item.title: Improvement 101
item.description: SAID (Specific Adaptation to Imposed Demand) Patience is for losers. (If patience really is necessary it will be learned in the process) Your body is not a toy.

item.title: Philosophy 101
item.description: Metaphysics Do you believe in god? What are the limits of the powers of such a god? Is it a moral agent? Is the world essentially material or physical? Do human beings have a soul? Is there ...

item.title: Philosophy 102
item.description: Epistemology What according to you is truth? What separates it from belief? Do we have any knowledge at all? Does absolute knowledge exist? In epistemology again, there is a distinction ...

item.title: Philosophy 103
item.description: Axiology Aesthetics Ethics Consequentialism arguments against consequentialism Applied Ethics:.

item.title: Psychology 101
item.description: The framework that makes most psychological observations fall into place is the following: Human brains are evolved to survive, not thrive. All behavior is in essence an adaptation to minimize the effort expended for surviving in perceived circumstances.
